[Page Title: Matador | Mexican Restaurant & Tequila Bar | Best Happy Hour]

Welcome to the Matador

Come in and be enveloped by our passion for the most daring of spirits. For brave, fresh Mexican flavors, and beautiful scratch-made cocktails. For the people and the culture of Mexico, where we forge friendships with tequila makers, listen to their stories, and bring them home to share with you, as we guide you through your tequila experience. Choose from the most diverse selection of tequilas you’ll find anywhere—in a space filled with furnishings and fittings inspired by our travels, and crafted by our founder’s own hands. Join us. We invite you to become a part of the journey.

Taste Mexico Reimagined

The Matador uses all-natural ingredients only, and that includes our carne, pollo, carnitas and seafood. We source the freshest, in-season vegetables and fruits available. Then we take those ingredients and cook them up into creative dishes that taste a bit like Mexico, a bit like the local area, and a bit like nothing you’ve ever tasted before.
Please click to see our current takeout menu, including our Take n Bake dishes, Familia meals, and beverages to go. Order Online 
Please select your to view our current dine-in menus.

We Know Tequila

Drinking tequila is like drinking in the essence of Mexico.

The Matador believes there’s a perfect tequila for every person and every occasion, and we love nothing more than helping our guests discover theirs. We’ve curated a collection of more than 150 tequilas that we feel are truly excellent, from all over Mexico. Some are available exclusively at the Matador. We even serve our own Private Reserve Tequila—from barrels we select personally after tastings with the makers in Mexico.

This gives you endless ways to experience the fun of this wild and extraordinary spirit, and the nuances of the different regions of Mexico where it’s produced. Try a margarita made with our own fresh, house-made sour mix, or one of our many other creative cocktails crafted by our in-house mixologist. Let us guide you through a flight, to discover something new and intriguing. Or just savor a beautiful shot of your all-time favorite.

Want free nachos?!

Join our (free) loyalty program and receive an order of our standard Grande Nachos when you download The Matador app! Plus earn points for every dollar spent, get a free dessert on your birthday & more!
Sign Up Now

About Us

At the Matador, tequila is more than a beverage—it’s almost a culture of its own. We immerse ourselves in it. We know the landscape and the people who make a difference within it. We love everything about tequila, and we enjoy sharing our knowledge, to help our guests appreciate it as much as we do.

We serve a menu of scratch-made dishes that complement the nuances of great blancos, reposados and añejos, with exciting preparations that re-think Mexican, always fresh ingredients and creative plate presentations. The restaurant interiors reflect the craft, heart, soul and sense of adventure that live inside every good bottle of tequila.

Step into the Matador, and gain insider access to the world of tequila, the flavorful foods that go with it and the rarified atmosphere of craft, care and pleasure it creates.

Cater Your Event

Click below to see our outside catering menus. Whether ordering lunch for the office, or a taco bar for a special event, we've got you covered.
Order Catering Online 
Hosted Events

Tucked away from the crowd, the Matador offers several unique private spaces for you and your group. We’ll help you with all the details for a perfect event, whether you’re planning a gathering of friends and family, a business luncheon, a professional workshop, or even a tequila tasting seminar.

Take a look at our in-house catering menus:
Catering Menu 
Our Event Venues

We have many wonderful options in the Seattle, Portland, Charleston, and Boise areas. See the venues available near you, and inquire about hosting your event with us!
Find Your Venue

Mezcal
Made from a variety of different agaves and usually produced by fire-roasting piñas in underground pits, giving mezcals the smokiness they are known for. Mezcals are an older and more traditional form of agave spirit and tend to have stronger, more intense flavor profiles than tequilas. 
Approachable
For the beginners. Espadín and other milder agaves produce mezcals with gentle charred agave sweetness, moderate citrus, tropical fruit, burnt hardwoods, and earth. 
Exotic
For the curious. Wild-harvested agaves and single village bottlings have very unique flavor profiles and strongly express their terroir, producing varied notes of vegetation, earth, mineral, fruits, citrus, spice and herbs. 
Artisanal
For the bold. Rare agaves and traditional production techniques produce incredibly complex mezcals with a wide array of pungent aromas and intense flavors.

Joven & Cristalino
100% agave Jovens are blancos blended with small amounts of reposados or añejos so that the intense agave notes found in a blanco are balanced by the deeper notes of an aged tequila. Cristalinos are aged tequilas that have been filtered to remove colors and heavier
wood notes that come from barrel-aging, resulting in a tequila with the complexity of an añejo but with the bright notes and color of a blanco. 
Joven & Cristalino

wood notes that come from barrel-aging, resulting in a tequila with the complexity of an añejo but with the bright notes and color of a blanco.

Ilegal Joven / Banhez Artesanal / Del Maguey Vida Puebla

Classic Espadín notes of clean agave, citrus, & light smoke / Floral, fruity blend of Espadín & Barril agaves with balanced spice and citrus / Single-village expression from the base of the volcano Popocatépetl; green herb & vegetal notes with savory roasted agave
$16 
Beginner II

Nuestra Soledad San Luis del Rio / Koch Espadín San Baltazar Guélavila / Don Amado Rustico

High-mountain, single-village Espadín; balanced agave, mineral, citrus / From the Tlacolula district in the Valles Centrales region; subtle mineral, fruit, herbs, & brine / Clay pot-distilled
Espadín from Santa Catarina Minas; deep, warm, floral
$20 
Advance I

Real Minero Largo / Mezcales de Leyenda Guerrero / Tileño Tepextate

Rare, wild agave from the Karwinskii family; sharp fruit, chocolate, dry ash & smoke / Cupreata agave wild-harvested from high-altitude oak forests; complex tropical & citrus notes with subtle spice / Seldom-distilled 25-year-old wild agave; deep fruit, intense mineral, spice & citrus
$36 
Advanced II

Bozal Chino Verde Ancestral Reserva / Mezcales de Leyenda Durrango / Del Maguey Pechuga

Rare agave foraged from the Sierra Madre del Sur mountains; pronounced herb and smoke, charred wood & desert soil / High-altitude desert maguey Cenizo; buttery, intense, exotic
fruit, earth & clay / Espadín clay pot-distilled with chicken breast & wild-mountain apples, bananas, pineapples, & plums
$41 
Aficionada

Chacolo Ixtero Amarillo / C ódigo Ancestral Papalomé /
Coyote Sotol Vibora

Maguey Ixtero Amarillo milled by hand with axes, naturally
fermented in wooden tinas, and distilled in a Filipino still made
of copper and a hollowed out tree trunk; creamy but dry,
aggresive herbs, spice, salinity, & tropical fruit / Tobala agaves harvested from sub-tropical forests in mountain canyons &
fermented in leather tanks; rustic & raw, intensely floral,
aromatic, vegetal, & sweet / Pechuga-style Sotol distilled with
rattlesnake meat & rattlesnake venom before a 2-month aging; savory & full-bodied with powerful mineral, herb, & salinity
$41 
Mezcal
Made from a variety of different agaves and usually produced by fire-roasting piñas in underground pits, giving mezcals the smokiness they are known for. Mezcals are an older and more traditional form of agave spirit and tend to have stronger, more intense flavor profiles than tequilas. 
Approachable
For the beginners. Espadín and other milder agaves produce mezcals with gentle charred agave sweetness, moderate citrus, tropical fruit, burnt hardwoods, and earth. 
Advanced
For the curious. Wild-harvested agaves and single village bottlings have
very unique flavor profiles and strongly express their terroir, producing
varied notes of vegetation, earth, mineral, fruits, citrus, spice, and herbs. 
Exotic
For the bold. Rare agaves and ancestral production techniques produce
incredibly complex mezcals with a wide array of pungent aromas and intense flavors.

Mezcal
Made from a variety of different agaves and usually produced by fire-roasting piñas in underground pits, giving mezcals the smokiness they are known for. Mezcals are an older and more traditional form of agave spirit and tend to have stronger, more intense flavor profiles than tequilas. 
Approachable
For the beginners. Espadín and other milder agaves produce mezcals with gentle charred agave sweetness, moderate citrus, tropical fruit, burnt hardwoods, and earth. 
Exotic
For the curious. Wild-harvested agaves and single village bottlings have very unique flavor profiles and strongly express their terroir, producing varied notes of vegetation, earth, mineral, fruits, citrus, spice and herbs. 
Artisanal
For the bold. Rare agaves and traditional production techniques produce incredibly complex mezcals with a wide array of pungent aromas and intense flavors.

Joven & Cristalino
100% agave Jovens are blancos blended with small amounts of reposados or añejos so that the intense agave notes found in a blanco are balanced by the deeper notes of an aged tequila. Cristalinos are aged tequilas that have been filtered to remove colors and heavier
wood notes that come from barrel-aging, resulting in a tequila with the complexity of an añejo but with the bright notes and color of a blanco. 
Joven & Cristalino

wood notes that come from barrel-aging, resulting in a tequila with the complexity of an añejo but with the bright notes and color of a blanco.

Blanco
(also called Silver, White, or Plata tequilas)
Bottled either right from the still with no aging or allowed to brieﬂy mellow in stainless steel tanks for up to 60 days, blanco tequilas are fresh, bright, and agave forward. This expression is ideal when looking to experience the intense, pure aromas and ﬂavors of a tequila.

Mezcal
Made from a variety of different agaves and usually produced by fire-roasting piñas in underground pits, giving mezcals the smokiness they are known for. Mezcals are an older and more traditional form of agave spirit and tend to have stronger, more intense flavor profiles than tequilas. 
Approachable
For the beginners. Espadín and other milder agaves produce mezcals with gentle charred agave sweetness, moderate citrus, tropical fruit, burnt hardwoods, and earth. 
Exotic
For the curious. Wild-harvested agaves and single village bottlings have very unique flavor profiles and strongly express their terroir, producing varied notes of vegetation, earth, mineral, fruits, citrus, spice and herbs. 
Artisanal
For the bold. Rare agaves and traditional production techniques produce incredibly complex mezcals with a wide array of pungent aromas and intense flavors. 
Approachable
For the beginners. Espadín and other milder agaves produce mezcals with gentle charred agave sweetness, moderate citrus, tropical fruit, burnt hardwoods, and earth.

Joven & Cristalino
100% agave Jovens are blancos blended with small amounts of reposados or añejos so that the intense agave notes found in a blanco are balanced by the deeper notes of an aged tequila. Cristalinos are aged tequilas that have been filtered to remove colors and heavier
wood notes that come from barrel-aging, resulting in a tequila with the complexity of an añejo but with the bright notes and color of a blanco.

Mezcal
Made from a variety of different agaves and usually produced by fire-roasting piñas in underground pits, giving mezcals the smokiness they are known for. Mezcals are an older and more traditional form of agave spirit and tend to have stronger, more intense flavor profiles than tequilas. 
Approachable
For the beginners. Espadín and other milder agaves produce mezcals with gentle charred agave sweetness, moderate citrus, tropical fruit, burnt hardwoods, and earth. 
Advanced
For the curious. Wild-harvested agaves and single village bottlings have
very unique flavor profiles and strongly express their terroir, producing
varied notes of vegetation, earth, mineral, fruits, citrus, spice, and herbs. 
Exotic
For the bold. Rare agaves and ancestral production techniques produce
incredibly complex mezcals with a wide array of pungent aromas and intense flavors.

Mezcal
Made from a variety of different agaves and usually produced by fire-roasting piñas in underground pits, giving mezcals the smokiness they are known for. Mezcals are an older and more traditional form of agave spirit and tend to have stronger, more intense flavor profiles than tequilas. 
Approachable
For the beginners. Espadín and other milder agaves produce mezcals with gentle charred agave sweetness, moderate citrus, tropical fruit, burnt hardwoods, and earth. 
Exotic
For the curious. Wild-harvested agaves and single village bottlings have very unique flavor profiles and strongly express their terroir, producing varied notes of vegetation, earth, mineral, fruits, citrus, spice and herbs. 
Artisanal
For the bold. Rare agaves and traditional production techniques produce incredibly complex mezcals with a wide array of pungent aromas and intense flavors.

Joven & Cristalino
100% agave Jovens are blancos blended with small amounts of reposados or añejos so that the intense agave notes found in a blanco are balanced by the deeper notes of an aged tequila. Cristalinos are aged tequilas that have been filtered to remove colors and heavier
wood notes that come from barrel-aging, resulting in a tequila with the complexity of an añejo but with the bright notes and color of a blanco. 
Joven & Cristalino
100% agave Jovens are blancos blended with small amounts of reposados or añejos so that the intense agave notes found in a blanco are balanced by the deeper notes of an aged tequila. Cristalinos are aged tequilas that have been filtered to remove colors and heavier
wood notes that come from barrel-aging, resulting in a tequila with the complexity of an añejo but with the bright notes and color of a blanco.

Maguey Ixtero Amarillo milled by hand with axes, naturally
fermented in wooden tinas, and distilled in a Filipino still made
of copper and a hollowed out tree trunk; creamy but dry,
aggresive herbs, spice, salinity, & tropical fruit / Tobala agaves harvested from sub-tropical forests in mountain canyons &
fermented in leather tanks; rustic & raw, intensely floral,
aromatic, vegetal, & sweet / Pechuga-style Sotol distilled with
rattlesnake meat & rattlesnake venom before a 2-month aging; savory & full-bodied with powerful mineral, herb, & salinity

Mezcal
Made from a variety of different agaves and usually produced by fire-roasting piñas in underground pits, giving mezcals the smokiness they are known for. Mezcals are an older and more traditional form of agave spirit and tend to have stronger, more intense flavor profiles than tequilas. 
Approachable
For the beginners. Espadín and other milder agaves produce mezcals with gentle charred agave sweetness, moderate citrus, tropical fruit, burnt hardwoods, and earth. 
Advanced
For the curious. Wild-harvested agaves and single village bottlings have
very unique flavor profiles and strongly express their terroir, producing
varied notes of vegetation, earth, mineral, fruits, citrus, spice, and herbs. 
Exotic
For the bold. Rare agaves and ancestral production techniques produce
incredibly complex mezcals with a wide array of pungent aromas and intense flavors.

[Page Title: Private Events]

Private Events

Tucked away from the crowd, the Matador offers several unique private spaces for you and your group. We’ll help you with all the details for a perfect event, whether you’re planning a gathering of friends and family, a business luncheon, a professional workshop, or even a tequila tasting seminar.

We have many wonderful options in the Seattle, Portland, Boise and South Carolina areas. See the venues available near you, and inquire about hosting your event with us!

Mezcaleria & Ballroom
• Ballard (Seattle, WA) 
5410 Ballard Ave NW, Seattle, WA 98107 | (206) 297-2855

Whether you’re planning a private dinner with friends, a surprise birthday party for your loved ones or a meeting luncheon with AV capability, Ballard has the perfect space for you. The Ballroom and the Mezcaleria each offer their own unique style and amenities, providing the perfect backdrop for any occasion from meetings to celebrations. Choose from our many customized menus for sit-down dinners and buffet-style entertaining. We provide one or more servers for every gathering, so you can relax and enjoy the company of your guests, our delicious food and drinks, and the intimate, exciting and fun atmosphere of our Ballard location.
BOOK WITH US ON TRIPLESEAT Book Mezcaleria & Ballroom, Ballard 
Charleston Event Spaces
• Charleston, SC 
235 Meeting St, Charleston, SC 29401 | (843)-789-4747

The Matador Charleston is the perfect place to host your next event, no matter the size or type. With our unique atmosphere and versatile event spaces, we can help you create a memorable and enjoyable experience for your guests.

Our spaces can accommodate groups of all sizes, from intimate gatherings to large corporate parties. We offer a private bar, an outdoor patio, catering, and TVs to ensure that your event has everything you need.

From appetizers and entrees to desserts and drinks, we offer a wide range of customizable menu options to suit any need or budget. Whether you're planning a small gathering or a large-scale event, we can work with you to create a food and beverage menu that your guests will love. We also happily work with any dietary preferences or restrictions you may have so that everyone can enjoy.

We look forward to helping you create a truly unforgettable event at The Matador Charleston!
BOOK WITH US ON TRIPLESEAT Book Charleston Event Spaces, Charleston 
The Añejo Room
• Portland, OR 
1438 NW 23rd Ave, Portland, OR 97210 | 503-228-2855

Whether you’re planning a private dinner with friends, a surprise birthday party for your loved ones, or a meeting luncheon--NW Matador has the perfect space for you. Our room can accommodate up to 30 guests, and when the weather is right, the large garage door opens to create a beautiful indoor-outdoor experience. Choose from our many customized menus for sit-down dinners and buffet-style entertaining. We provide one or more servers for every gathering, so you can relax and enjoy the company of your guests, our delicious food and drinks, and the intimate, exciting and fun atmosphere of our NW 23rd Avenue location. Please note that we are unable to rent out the Añejo room for dinner on Fridays and Saturdays.
Book The Añejo Room, NW Portland 
The Blanco Room
• Portland, OR 
2424 E Burnside St. Portland, OR 97214 | 503-719-5757

Whether you’re planning a business meeting, celebration, or a surprise event, our private party room in East Portland is a comfortable venue for hosting up to 35 guests, ages 21 and over. Easily accessible for those with physical limitations, this modern, romantic space is an extension of our restaurant’s intimate, yet casual atmosphere. For an indoor-outdoor feel, the room’s large window installations can be opened like a garage door, giving your guests access to the side patio. Whether you prefer sit-down or buffet-style service, our staff is happy to help you plan every detail, from special bar items or individually ordered beverages, to appetizer, entree and dessert options curated by our house chef.
Book The Blanco Room, East Portland 
The Mezzanine
• Meridian, ID 
3690 E Monarch Sky Ln #140, Meridian, ID 83646 | 208-893-6120

The Casa Del Matador in The Village at Meridian invites you to hold your gathering in a private Mezzanine space, up above the dining area and bar. Artisan-forged metal dividers, Spanish-style wallpaper, brickwork and handcrafted tables define this unique room, illuminated by flickering candlelight through hand-wrought sconces. An ideal venue for business meetings, parties, celebrations, and events of any kind, the mezzanine is above expectations, offering a very special point of view. Enjoy the openness and the view over the restaurant, or draw the curtains and revel in your privacy.
Book The Mezzanine, Meridian 
Reposado Room
• Portland, OR 
4111 N Williams Ave, Portland, OR 97217 | (503) 841-6326

The North Williams location is sophisticated, yet casual and welcoming: the warm open fire pits, heavy red velvet drapes, candlelight, and handmade woodwork all make for a unique and comforting ambiance. This spacious room can be arranged to your liking and has the option of being closed off to provide a private setting or left open for a more casual gathering. The room is equipped with a high-definition television that can be turned to the channel of your choice. The Matador is ideal for your next corporate offsite meeting, wedding rehearsal dinner, birthday, sporting event party or any other occasion. Come join us and make your next party one to remember!

Mezcal
Made from a variety of different agaves and usually produced by fire-roasting piñas in underground pits, giving mezcals the smokiness they are known for. Mezcals are an older and more traditional form of agave spirit and tend to have stronger, more intense flavor profiles than tequilas. 
Approachable
For the beginners. Espadín and other milder agaves produce mezcals with gentle charred agave sweetness, moderate citrus, tropical fruit, burnt hardwoods, and earth. 
Exotic
For the curious. Wild-harvested agaves and single village bottlings have very unique flavor profiles and strongly express their terroir, producing varied notes of vegetation, earth, mineral, fruits, citrus, spice and herbs. 
Artisanal
For the bold. Rare agaves and traditional production techniques produce incredibly complex mezcals with a wide array of pungent aromas and intense flavors.

Joven & Cristalino
100% agave Jovens are blancos blended with small amounts of reposados or añejos so that the intense agave notes found in a blanco are balanced by the deeper notes of an aged tequila. Cristalinos are aged tequilas that have been filtered to remove colors and heavier
wood notes that come from barrel-aging, resulting in a tequila with the complexity of an añejo but with the bright notes and color of a blanco. 
Joven & Cristalino
100% agave Jovens are blancos blended with small amounts of reposados or añejos so that the intense agave notes found in a blanco are balanced by the deeper notes of an aged tequila. Cristalinos are aged tequilas that have been filtered to remove colors and heavier
wood notes that come from barrel-aging, resulting in a tequila with the complexity of an añejo but with the bright notes and color of a blanco.

Mezcal
Made from a variety of different agaves and usually produced by fire-roasting piñas in underground pits, giving mezcals the smokiness they are known for. Mezcals are an older and more traditional form of agave spirit and tend to have stronger, more intense flavor profiles than tequilas. 
Approachable
For the beginners. Espadín and other milder agaves produce mezcals with gentle charred agave sweetness, moderate citrus, tropical fruit, burnt hardwoods, and earth. 
Exotic
For the curious. Wild-harvested agaves and single village bottlings have very unique flavor profiles and strongly express their terroir, producing varied notes of vegetation, earth, mineral, fruits, citrus, spice and herbs. 
Artisanal
For the bold. Rare agaves and traditional production techniques produce incredibly complex mezcals with a wide array of pungent aromas and intense flavors.

Joven & Cristalino
100% agave Jovens are blancos blended with small amounts of reposados or añejos so that the intense agave notes found in a blanco are balanced by the deeper notes of an aged tequila. Cristalinos are aged tequilas that have been filtered to remove colors and heavier
wood notes that come from barrel-aging, resulting in a tequila with the complexity of an añejo but with the bright notes and color of a blanco.

wood notes that come from barrel-aging, resulting in a tequila with the complexity of an añejo but with the bright notes and color of a blanco.

Mezcal
Made from a variety of different agaves and usually produced by fire-roasting piñas in underground pits, giving mezcals the smokiness they are known for. Mezcals are an older and more traditional form of agave spirit and tend to have stronger, more intense flavor profiles than tequilas. 
Approachable
For the beginners. Espadín and other milder agaves produce mezcals with gentle charred agave sweetness, moderate citrus, tropical fruit, burnt hardwoods, and earth. 
Exotic
For the curious. Wild-harvested agaves and single village bottlings have very unique flavor profiles and strongly express their terroir, producing varied notes of vegetation, earth, mineral, fruits, citrus, spice and herbs. 
Artisanal
For the bold. Rare agaves and traditional production techniques produce incredibly complex mezcals with a wide array of pungent aromas and intense flavors.

Joven & Cristalino
100% agave Jovens are blancos blended with small amounts of reposados or añejos so that the intense agave notes found in a blanco are balanced by the deeper notes of an aged tequila. Cristalinos are aged tequilas that have been filtered to remove colors and heavier
wood notes that come from barrel-aging, resulting in a tequila with the complexity of an añejo but with the bright notes and color of a blanco. 
Joven & Cristalino

wood notes that come from barrel-aging, resulting in a tequila with the complexity of an añejo but with the bright notes and color of a blanco.

Mezcal
Made from a variety of different agaves and usually produced by fire-roasting piñas in underground pits, giving mezcals the smokiness they are known for. Mezcals are an older and more traditional form of agave spirit and tend to have stronger, more intense flavor profiles than tequilas. 
Approachable
For the beginners. Espadín and other milder agaves produce mezcals with gentle charred agave sweetness, moderate citrus, tropical fruit, burnt hardwoods, and earth. 
Advanced
For the curious. Wild-harvested agaves and single village bottlings have
very unique flavor profiles and strongly express their terroir, producing
varied notes of vegetation, earth, mineral, fruits, citrus, spice, and herbs. 
Exotic
For the bold. Rare agaves and ancestral production techniques produce
incredibly complex mezcals with a wide array of pungent aromas and intense flavors.

Matador Charleston

The Matador is located in the heart of downtown Charleston. Here, we celebrate Mexico's flavors and the world of tequila and agave spirits. The menu features scratch-made dishes using the freshest seasonal produce, seafoods, and meats and the tequila list is extensive, with something to suit every taste. The restaurant's interior is stylish, sophisticated, warm, and inviting. On weekends, experience our upstairs Mezcaleria bar or grab a seat on our rooftop patio. The staff is knowledgeable about tequila and Mexican-inspired cuisine, and they are ready to guide your experience to help you find your perfect drink and dish. Whether you're a tequila connoisseur or just looking for a delicious meal, The Matador is the perfect place to experience the best of Mexico!
